name: voidable
content:

Add to word list
If a legal agreement is voidable, it is possible to remove its legal force: The contract was said to be voidable because of the company's fraudulent practices. In order to be annulled, the marriage must be void or voidable. A voidable contract is one that is capable of being invalidated.
More examplesFewer examplesThe transfer of stock might be voidable.The court would have this power if the transfer were merely voidable, as opposed to void.The Act provides that such a transaction is voidable.He has signed a two-year deal that is voidable after this season.If this is the case, the contract was entered into unethically and would be voidable under state law.
